item.description:
What do Shabu Shabu and playing Pool have in common? STICKS! Chop sticks and Pool (que) sticks.


Two REALLY fun things to do all within walking distance in Chinatown/Downtown crossing in Boston.

Meet at 6:30pm Dinner at Shabu Shabu at Kaze in Chinatown:

Japanese hot pot (SHabu-Shabu) is a really fun and delicious fondue style soup dinner. Its very healthy and there are all sorts of dinner options including vegetarian.

Shabu-shabu was introduced in Japan in the 20th century with the opening of a Shabu-shabu restaurant "Suehiro"[1] in Osaka. Its origins are traced back to the Chinese hot pot known as "shuan yang rou". Shabu-shabu is most similar to the original Chinese version when compared to other Japanese steamboat dishes (nabemono) such as sukiyaki. Read it all here

After dinner we will walk around the corner to Felt to play some pool

Felt is a cool restaurant / billiards / nightclub that really doesn't get packed until late in the evening.
I will have a table (or two) reserved for us on the second floor. There is plenty of seating, and waitstaff will take orders for drinks and appetizers.
item.name: The Party with the STICKS.
